intro: Colignonia pentoptera, commonly known as the five-lobed colignonia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed, typically with five distinct lobes, giving it its scientific name. Colignonia pentoptera is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
